snippet.title: Manhunt after servo robbery
snippet.content: A MANHUNT has been launched after a service station robbery in Adelaide's north. Police were called to the United station, on Main North Rd, Pooraka, just before midnight on Thursday night after a man threatened staff with a knife and demanded cash. The man fled on foot, running west with an undisclosed amount of cash. Police patrols and police dog Roy failed to find the suspect despite a widespread search. No one was physically injured and a police spokeswoman said investigations were continuing. The suspect is described as being 180 to185cm tall, of medium build and dark skin. He was wearing a dark jumper with white writing on the front, dark trousers and had his face covered. Police are appealing for witnesses to call Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000.
